member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Builder.Conventions.AssociationSetDiscoveryConvention
member.summary: to configure the EDM association sets for the given entity set. This convention adds an association set for each EDM navigation property defined in this type, its base types and all its derived types. The target navigation source chosen is the default navigation source for the navigation property's target entity type. The default navigation source for an entity type is the navigation source that contains entity of that entity type. If more than one navigation source match, the default navigation source is none. If no navigation sources match the default navigation source is the default navigation source of the base type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Builder.Conventions.AbstractTypeDiscoveryConvention

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Builder.LowerCamelCaser
member.summary: Default lower camel caser to resolve property names for . The rule is to convert the leading upper case characters to lower case, until a character, which is not the first character and is followed by a non-upper case character, is met. id => id, ID => id, MyName => myName, IOStream => ioStream, MyID => myid, yourID => yourID

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Builder.BindingParameterConfiguration
member.summary:
Represents a BindingParameter.
Actions/Functions can have at most one BindingParameter. This parameter has similar semantics to the 'this' keyword in C# extensions methods.
For example given a url that identifies a Movie, if there is an action that has a bindingParameter that is a Movie, you can bind the Action to the url.
i.e. if ~/Movies(1) identifies a Movie, and there exists a Checkout action that has a Movie BindingParameter, you can invoke that Action at this url ~/Movies(1)/Checkout
The BindingParameter type must either be an EntityType or a Collection of EntityTypes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Builder.BindingParameterConfiguration.DefaultBindingParameterName
member.summary: The default parameter name for an action's binding parameter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Builder.BindingParameterConfiguration.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Builder.IEdmTypeConfiguration)
member.summary: Create a BindingParameterConfiguration
member.param: The name of the Binding Parameter
The type of the Binding Parameter

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Builder.NonbindingParameterConfiguration
member.summary:
Represents a non-binding operation parameter.
Non binding parameters are provided in the POST body for Actions Non binding parameters are provided in 3 ways for Functions - ~/.../Function(p1=value) - ~/.../Function(p1=@x)?@x=value - ~/.../Function?p1=value (only allowed if the Function is the last url path segment).

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.Expressions.PropertyContainer
member.summary: A container of property names and property values.
member.remarks: EntityFramework understands only member initializations in Select expressions. Also, it doesn't understand type casts for non-primitive types. So, SelectExpandBinder has to generate strongly types expressions that involve only property access. This class represents the base class for a bunch of generic derived types that are used in the expressions that SelectExpandBinder generates. Also, Expression.Compile() could fail with stack overflow if expression is to deep and causes too many levels of recursion. To avoid that we are b-tree property container.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.param: The dictionary to add the properties to.
Specifies whether auto selected properties should be included.
An object responsible to map the properties in this property container to the the value that will be used as the key in the dictionary we are adding properties to.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.Expressions.AggregationPropertyContainer
member.summary: Reperesent properties used in groupby and aggregate clauses to make them accessiable in further clauses/transformations
member.remakrs:
When we have $apply=groupby((Prop1,Prop2, Prop3))&$orderby=Prop1, Prop2 We will have following expression in .GroupBy $it => new AggregationPropertyContainer() { Name = "Prop1", Value = $it.Prop1, // string Next = new AggregationPropertyContainer() { Name = "Prop2", Value = $it.Prop2, // int Next = new LastInChain() { Name = "Prop3", Value = $it.Prop3 } } } when in $orderby (see AggregationBinder CollectProperties method) Prop1 could be referenced us $it => (string)$it.Value Prop2 could be referenced us $it => (int)$it.Next.Value Prop3 could be referenced us $it => (int)$it.Next.Next.Value Generic type for Value is used to avoid type casts for on primitive types that not supported in EF
Also we have 4 use cases and base type have all requiered properties to support no cast usage. 1. Primitive property with Next 2. Primitive property without Next 3. Nested property with Next 4. Nested property without Next However, EF doesn't allow to set different properties for the same type in two places in an lamba-expression => using new type with just new name to workaround that issue

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.Expressions.UriFunctionsBinder
member.summary: This class helps to bind uri functions to CLR. For creating an Expression and apply it on a Queryable collection, we must get the CLR information, i.e MethodInfo of each EdmFunction which is mentioned in the EdmModel. If you add a custom uri function in OData.Core via 'CustomUriFunctions' class, you must bind it to it's MethodInfo.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.Expressions.UriFunctionsBinder.BindUriFunctionName(System.String,System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Bind the given function name to the given MethodInfo. The binding helps to create an Expression out of the method. You can bind a static method, a static extension method, and an instance method. You should be carefull about binding instance methods - the declaring type of the method i.e the instance type, will be considered as the first argument of the function.
member.param: The uri function name that appears in the OData request uri.
The MethodInfo to bind the given function name.
member.exception: Function name argument is Null or empty
The given FunctionName is already binded to another MethodInfo.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.Expressions.UriFunctionsBinder.UnbindUriFunctionName(System.String,System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Unbind the given function name from the given MethodInfo.

The MethodInfo to unbind from the given function name.
member.exception: Function name argument is Null or empty
member.returns: 'True' if function has unbinded. 'False' otherwise.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.Expressions.ModelContainer
member.summary: EntityFramework does not let you inject non primitive constant values (like IEdmModel) in Select queries. Primitives like strings and guids can be injected as they can be translated into a SQL query. This container associates a unique string with each EDM model, so that, given the string the model can be retrieved later.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.IPropertyMapper
member.summary: The result of a $select and $expand projection is represented as an instance. That instance can be projected into an instance by calling . That method will use the function to construct an that will map the property names in that projection to the keys in the returned . The main purpose of converting an instance into an (using the method mentioned above) is to allow changing the names of the properties in the that will be used during the serialization of the $select and $expand projection by a given formatter. For example, to support custom serialization attributes of a particular formatter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.IPropertyMapper.MapProperty(System.String)
member.summary: Defines a mapping between the name of an of an and the name that should be used in other contexts, for example, when projecting an instance of an into an instance of an
member.param: The name of the property in the represented by this instance of .
member.returns: The value that will be used as the key for this property in the resulting from calling ToDictionary on an instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.SelectExpandQueryOption.LevelsMaxLiteralExpansionDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of levels that a top level $expand=NavigationProperty($levels=max) will be expanded. This value will decrease by one with each nesting level in the $expand clause. For example, with a property value 5, the following query $expand=A($expand=B($expand=C($levels=max))) will be interpreted as $expand=A($expand=B($expand=C($levels=3))). If the query gets validated, the value must be greater than or equal to this value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings
member.summary: This class describes the validation settings for querying.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedArithmeticOperators
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of allowed arithmetic operators including 'add', 'sub', 'mul', 'div', 'mod'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedFunctions
member.summary:
Gets or sets a list of allowed functions used in the $filter query.
The allowed functions include the following:
String related: contains, endswith, startswith, length, indexof, substring, tolower, toupper, trim, concat
e.g. ~/Customers?$filter=length(CompanyName) eq 19
Date and Time related: year, month, day, hour, minute, second, fractionalseconds, date, time
e.g. ~/Employees?$filter=year(BirthDate) eq 1971
Math related: round, floor, ceiling
Type related:isof, cast,
Collection related: any, all

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedLogicalOperators
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of allowed logical operators such as 'eq', 'ne', 'gt', 'ge', 'lt', 'le', 'and', 'or', 'not'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedOrderByProperties
member.summary:
Gets a list of properties one can orderby the result with. Note, by default this list is empty, it means it can be ordered by any property.
For example, having an empty collection means client can order the queryable result by any properties. Adding "Name" to this list means that it only allows queryable result to be ordered by Name property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedQueryOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the query parameters that are allowed inside query. The default is all query options, including $filter, $skip, $top, $orderby, $expand, $select, $count, $format, $skiptoken and $deltatoken.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.MaxOrderByNodeCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of expressions that can be present in the $orderby.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.MaxAnyAllExpressionDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depth of the Any or All elements nested inside the query.
member.remarks: The default value is 1.
member.value: The maximum depth of the Any or All elements nested inside the query.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.MaxNodeCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of the nodes inside the $filter syntax tree.
member.remarks: The default value is 100.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.MaxSkip
member.summary: Gets or sets the max value of $skip that a client can request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.MaxTop
member.summary: Gets or sets the max value of $top that a client can request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.MaxExpansionDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the max expansion depth for the $expand query option.
member.remarks: To disable the maximum expansion depth check, set this property to 0.

member.summary: This enum defines how to handle null propagation in queryable support.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.HandleNullPropagationOption.Default
member.summary: Determine how to handle null propagation based on the query provider during query composition. This is the default value used in

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.HandleNullPropagationOption.True
member.summary: Handle null propagation during query composition.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.HandleNullPropagationOption.False
member.summary: Do not handle null propagation during query composition.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataQuerySettings
member.summary: This class describes the settings to use during query composition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataQuerySettings.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiates a new instance of the class and initializes the default settings.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataQuerySettings.ModelBoundPageSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of query results to return based on the type or property.
member.value: The maximum number of query results to return based on the type or property, or null if there is no limit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataQuerySettings.EnsureStableOrdering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether query composition should alter the original query when necessary to ensure a stable sort order.
member.value: A true value indicates the original query should be modified when necessary to guarantee a stable sort order. A false value indicates the sort order can be considered stable without modifying the query. Query providers that ensure a stable sort order should set this value to false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataQuerySettings.HandleNullPropagation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how null propagation should be handled during query composition.
member.value: The default is .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataQuerySettings.EnableConstantParameterization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether constants should be parameterized. Parameterizing constants would result in better performance with Entity framework.
member.value: The default value is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataQuerySettings.PageSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of query results to return.
member.value: The maximum number of query results to return, or null if there is no limit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Query.ODataQuerySettings.HandleReferenceNavigationPropertyExpandFilter
member.summary: Honor $filter inside $expand of non-collection navigation property. The expanded property is only populated when the filter evaluates to true. This setting is false by default.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.EnableQueryAttribute
member.summary: This class defines an attribute that can be applied to an action to enable querying using the OData query syntax. To avoid processing unexpected or malicious queries, use the validation settings on to validate incoming queries. For more information, visit http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=279712.
Partial implementation of the EnableQueryAttribute.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.OnActionExecuted(System.Web.Http.Filters.HttpActionExecutedContext)
member.summary: Performs the query composition after action is executed. It first tries to retrieve the IQueryable from the returning response message. It then validates the query from uri based on the validation settings on . It finally applies the query appropriately, and reset it back on the response message.
member.param: The context related to this action, including the response message, request message and HttpConfiguration etc.

member.summary: Validates the OData query in the incoming request. By default, the implementation throws an exception if the query contains unsupported query parameters. Override this method to perform additional validation of the query.
member.param: The instance constructed based on the incoming request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Enables a controller action to support OData query parameters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.EnsureStableOrdering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether query composition should alter the original query when necessary to ensure a stable sort order.
member.value: A true value indicates the original query should be modified when necessary to guarantee a stable sort order. A false value indicates the sort order can be considered stable without modifying the query. Query providers that ensure a stable sort order should set this value to false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.HandleNullPropagation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how null propagation should be handled during query composition.
member.value: The default is .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.EnableConstantParameterization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether constants should be parameterized. Parameterizing constants would result in better performance with Entity framework.
member.value: The default value is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.MaxAnyAllExpressionDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depth of the Any or All elements nested inside the query. This limit helps prevent Denial of Service attacks.
member.value: The maximum depth of the Any or All elements nested inside the query. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.MaxNodeCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of nodes inside the $filter syntax tree.
member.value: The default value is 100.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.PageSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of query results to send back to clients.
member.value: The maximum number of query results to send back to clients.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.HandleReferenceNavigationPropertyExpandFilter
member.summary: Honor $filter inside $expand of non-collection navigation property. The expanded property is only populated when the filter evaluates to true. This setting is false by default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.AllowedQueryOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the query parameters that are allowed in queries.
member.value: The default includes all query options: $filter, $skip, $top, $orderby, $expand, $select, $count, $format, $skiptoken and $deltatoken.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.AllowedFunctions
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that represents a list of allowed functions used in the $filter query. Supported functions include the following:
String related: contains, endswith, startswith, length, indexof, substring, tolower, toupper, trim, concat e.g. ~/Customers?$filter=length(CompanyName) eq 19
DateTime related: year, month, day, hour, minute, second, fractionalseconds, date, time e.g. ~/Employees?$filter=year(BirthDate) eq 1971
Math related: round, floor, ceiling
Type related: isof, cast
Collection related: any, all

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.AllowedArithmeticOperators
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents a list of allowed arithmetic operators including 'add', 'sub', 'mul', 'div', 'mod'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.AllowedLogicalOperators
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents a list of allowed logical Operators such as 'eq', 'ne', 'gt', 'ge', 'lt', 'le', 'and', 'or', 'not'.

summary.para: Gets or sets a string with comma separated list of property names. The queryable result can only be ordered by those properties defined in this list.
Note, by default this string is null, which means it can be ordered by any property.

For example, setting this value to null or empty string means that we allow ordering the queryable result by any properties. Setting this value to "Name" means we only allow queryable result to be ordered by Name property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.MaxSkip
member.summary: Gets or sets the max value of $skip that a client can request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.MaxTop
member.summary: Gets or sets the max value of $top that a client can request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.MaxExpansionDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the max expansion depth for the $expand query option. To disable the maximum expansion depth check, set this property to 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.MaxOrderByNodeCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of expressions that can be present in the $orderby.

Performs the query composition after action is executed. It first tries to retrieve the IQueryable from the returning response message. It then validates the query from uri based on the validation settings on . It finally applies the query appropriately, and reset it back on the response message.
member.param: The action context, i.e. action and controller name.
A function to get the model.
A function used to create and validate query options.
An action used to create a response.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.OData.Common.SRResources.MissingNonODataContainer
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Cannot find the services container for the non-OData route. This can occur when using OData components on the non-OData route and is usually a configuration issue. Call EnableDependencyInjection() to enable OData components on non-OData routes. This may also occur when a request was mistakenly handled by the ASP.NET Core routing layer instead of the OData routing layer, for instance the URL does not include the OData route prefix configured via a call to MapODataServiceRoute().
